item.description:
A Raisin in the Sun
Trinity Repertory Company

This is a classic. It's about a black family in Chicago who live in cramped quarters and when they get a windfall, consider moving to a white suburb. When the play debuted on Broadway in 1959 with a young Sidney Poitier in the cast, it was an immediate success and "changed American theatre forever."

Because Trinity Rep has reserved seating, you need to purchase your own ticket through Trinity's Box Office. You can use the message board on our site, or contact other Meetup members directly if you want to find someone to sit with. We will meet in the lobby after the play and head to Trinity Brewhouse around the corner.

PLEASE NOTE: Tickets are already going fairly quickly. All that's left is the Main Seating for $50. If you plan to attend, you may want to buy your ticket early.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in theatre lobby after the play -- look for Meetup sign
item.name: A Raisin in the Sun -- Trinity Rep
